Questions.question: Why do you want to work at LawnStarter?
Questions.answer: LawnStarter's mission to modernize the lawn care industry resonates with my passion for leveraging technology to improve everyday services. I'm excited by the opportunity to build scalable APIs and automate workflows at LawnStarter, contributing to a user-friendly and reliable platform.

Questions.question: Describe your experience with Python and React.
Questions.answer: I have experience with Python building backend systems using frameworks like NestJS, deploying them with technologies such as Docker on AWS. I have experience enhancing user experience by developing advanced UI features with React, as demonstrated in my work at Sony Pictures Entertainment.

Questions.question: Tell us about a time you automated a workflow successfully.
Questions.answer: At Sony Pictures Entertainment, I served as Environmental Manager and successfully automated many developer workflows. A key example was automating environment deployments and data refreshes using scripting which reduced manual intervention by 80%, significantly improving developer productivity and reducing errors.

Questions.question: Why are you interested in GreenTech?
Questions.answer: GreenTech's mission to create sustainable solutions resonates with my personal values, and I'm eager to contribute my backend expertise to a company making a positive impact. I'm particularly interested in leveraging my skills to optimize infrastructure and API performance for environmental initiatives.

Questions.question: Explain your experience with cloud platforms.
Questions.answer: I have experience deploying and managing applications on AWS, including using EC2, and have also worked with Firebase and Heroku. My "Dolores" project involved deploying a backend application on an AWS EC2 micro instance, horizontally scaling it, and load balancing with NGINX to handle significant user traffic.

Questions.question: Describe a backend project you are proud of.
Questions.answer: I'm proud of the "Dolores" project where I optimized an existing frontend by overhauling the backend to handle thousands of users. I ETL'd over 10 million records with PostgreSQL, implemented Redis caching, and achieved a 0% error rate at 60ms response time under heavy load.
